thread.title: ‘Moonlight’ wins Best Picture at after ‘La La Land’ flub
thread.title_full: ‘Moonlight’ wins Best Picture at Oscars after ‘La La Land’ flub - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: ‘Moonlight’ wins Best Picture at after ‘La La Land’ flub
text:
Paging Steve Harvey.
“La La Land” was mistakenly announced as the Best Picture at the Oscars Sunday night instead of “Moonlight,” the rightful winner.
In one of the most controversial categories of the night, Warren Beatty announced the Emma Stone-helmed flick as the Best Picture.
The cast crowded onto the stage for their acceptance speeches when suddenly Jordan Horowitz, the “La La Land” producer, announced the correction: actually, “Moonlight” won.
“I opened the envelope and it said Emma Stone, ‘La La Land,’” Beatty explained.
“That’s why I took such a long look at Faye (Dunaway). I wasn’t trying to be funny.”
Jordan Horowitz, "La La Land" producer, holds up the correct winner, "Moonlight" during his Best Picture acceptance speech. (LUCY NICHOLSON/REUTERS) After the mistake was corrected, the “Moonlight” cast, including Mahershala Ali and Naomie Harris, joined the chaos on stage to accept their award.
“I knew I would screw this show up,” Kimmel joked after the acceptance speeches.
“I really did.”
The embarrassing mistake was eerily reminiscent of Steve Harvey, who announced the wrong winner of Miss Universe in 2016.
